original:
In Cambodia, various natural sources are utilized for dyeing textiles. Red dye is derived from the nests of the lac insect, blue dye comes from indigo, yellow and green dyes are obtained from prohut bark, and black dye is produced from ebony bark.

The modern silk-weaving centers in Cambodia are located in the provinces of Takéo, Battambang, Banteay Meanchey, Siem Reap, and Kampot. Recently, the silk-weaving industry has experienced sig
